content.description:
Who doesn’t like to pull a huge roof, right?

From below the obvious big roof, use small holds on the face to reach a good hold where the roof starts heading out. From here reach out to the lip to find a nice thank god jug.

Using this hold at the lip, work your feet up as high as you can. Once possible, pull the crux moves my moving your hands up again to smaller yet solid holds. Pull your feet up onto the upper face and a solid stance. Work up small edges to the top where you will find a two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Start on the center of the south face of Roof Rock, below the large roof.

content.description: Work up blocks near the base onto a steeper blocky section mid-face. Face gets progressively steeper as you ascend. Pull over edge to ledge on top.
content.protection: Anchor using tree on backside of rock.
content.location: On the west face of Roof Rock. Climbs ascends the north side of the west face.

content.description: Climbed the day after Major League pitcher Jose Fernandez died. This route starts easy and gets harder as you climb. From the ground, work your up boulders and bulges, staying along the right side of the face. After clipping the first bolt, get up into steep upper face, finding good holds. Clip the last bolt while leaning back over the face. Pull the crux of the climb by working past the last steep section and onto the bulge on top where you will find a two bolt anchor.
content.location: On the south side of the west face on Roof Rock

content.description: From under the huge roof, work up the left side of the face, sticking to the arête. Reaching the roof, grab around the left side, step onto the arête itself and use small holds to continue up. Once past the roof, step left and “change sides” stepping onto the face shared with Jose’s Climb. Finish by pulling the last steep moves shared with Jose’s Climb, finding the shared two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: On the south face of Roof Rock, below prominent roof.

content.description: From below the big roof, work up the corner in large crack, almost chimney, using holds on the face and deep inside the crack. If you’re small you can get pretty far in the chimney, if your large you are forced to stay on the outside of the crack system. Once the corner reaches the edge of the large roof, reach out and left to good holds above the lip. With good footholds in the crack system and solid face holds above the roof, work up and leftwards. Once above the roof, work up using small edges to the two-bolt anchor shared with “The Roof.”
content.location: Starts in the corner on the east side of the south face of Roof Rock.
